title: U.S. to Discuss Scaling Back Military Exercises, Missile Deployments in Russia Talks
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is ready to discuss the deployment of U.S. missiles in Europe as well as reciprocal restrictions on the size and scope of military exercises on the continent when it meets on Monday with Russian negotiators in Geneva, U.S. officials said.

title: The Crowd That Lifted Up Eventbrite's CEO
summary: Julia Hartz relied on the help of key advisers to steer the ticketing and events-management company through a severe crisis. In Personal Board of Directors, top business leaders talk about the people they turn to for advice, and how those people have shaped their perspective and helped them succeed. Previous installments from the series are here.

title: Webb Space Telescope Wraps Up Risky Deployment but Faces More Hurdles
summary: NASA's $10 billion sun-orbiting observatory is now on track to begin its years-long mission to peer deeper into space than has ever been possible. After decades of development and two weeks after it launched into space aboard a towering rocket, the James Webb Space Telescope has completed its intricate unfolding process and is now fully deployed.

title: Sen. John Thune Says He Will Run for Re-Election
summary: South Dakota Republican, who has clashed with Trump, is seen as a possible successor to Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell. WASHINGTON-Sen. John Thune of South Dakota, the No. 2 Senate Republican, said Saturday he will run for re-election this year.

title: The 'January Effect' Doesn't Hold Up With Stocks. Bonds Are a Different Story.
summary: January has lost its crown as the perennial best month for stocks, our research shows. The new king: bonds.. The January effect is a theory in financial markets that has existed for 50-plus years. It states that stocks and other assets seem to go up the most in the first month of a year.

title: Covid-19 Cases Reach Records in U.S.
summary: Omicron is extending its reach across the country, pushing up hospitalizations as well as new infections. Covid-19 case counts in the U.S. reached record highs as the Omicron wave extended its reach through communities across the country.

title: Can Energy Stocks Stay Hot in 2022?
summary: For investors who are bullish on energy ETFs, here are some of their options. By most measures, 2021 was a good year to be an energy investor. According to research firm Morningstar Inc., energy outperformed every other funds sector, and asset flows into these funds grew a net $11.4 billion. As economies around the world started to reopen, energy demand surged, fueling a rebound by energy stocks.

title: Ethiopia Releases Opposition Figures as It Seeks End to War
summary: Decision follows U.S. envoy's meeting with Ethiopia's prime minister to press for a negotiated end to the conflict. Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed freed several opposition figures from prison and pledged to open dialogue with political opponents after 14 months of war that has threatened to tear apart Africa's second-most populous nation.

title: Mother Teresa's Charity in India Regains Access to Foreign Funding After Ban
summary: Blocking of funds on Christmas Day came amid Christian leaders' complaints of hostile environment for their religion in Hindu-majority country. NEW DELHI-India's government has restored approval for a Christian missionary group founded by the late Mother Teresa to receive foreign funding, two weeks after refusing that permission on Christmas Day.

title: McKinsey's Top Executive Wants to Change How the Firm Operates

title: Diving SPACs Are a Warning for Aerospace Startups
summary: Virgin Orbit's lackluster debut in the stock market should concern speculative ventures with larger valuations and far less tangible prospects. For speculative aerospace startups, taking off gets harder when market winds suddenly turn against you.

title: What's Your Personal-Finance Resolution for 2022? Here's What Readers Hope For
summary: More saving, smarter spending, new investment strategies. And plans to make it happen.. The past few years have caught many people unprepared-for prolonged financial hardship, a continuing bull market, rising inflation.

title: 12 Ways to Tame Your Family's Screen Time in 2022
summary: The new year brings new opportunity to improve our tech use; yes, that means no more phones in the bathroom. I spent a lot of 2021 writing about the detrimental effects that technology, and especially social media, has on kids. Cutting back on tech use almost always helped the teens I spoke with-and frankly, the rest of us would probably benefit from the same.

title: Omicron Fuels Fresh Surge, Threatening India's Hospitals Anew
summary: While politicians hold large maskless rallies, officials say they are securing more hospital beds, medicines and oxygen. NEW DELHI-With less than half of India's population fully vaccinated against Covid-19 and Omicron-variant infections rising rapidly, public-health experts warn that the healthcare system is again vulnerable-months after being overwhelmed by a surge of cases.

title: Facebook's Former Elections Boss Questions Social Media in Politics
summary: Katie Harbath says she left Facebook disillusioned; now she pushes for more online guardrails.

title: Mass Vaccination Sites for Covid-19 Are Back
summary: High-volume vaccine clinics are reopening during the Omicron surge, to reach children and administer more boosters. Public officials across the country are reopening temporary mass-vaccination sites that they wound down months ago, in an effort to get more people vaccinated and boosted in the latest Covid-19 surge driven by the Omicron variant.

title: Kazakhstan's Former Security Chief Is Detained on Treason Charges
summary: Resume Subscription. MOSCOW-Authorities in Kazakhstan detained the former head of the Central Asian country's domestic security agency and other officials, saying they were suspected of treason, as government forces, backed by Russian troops, sought to restore order after days of unrest.

title: For Dying Towns, the Pandemic Offers Challenges-and Hope
summary: Resume Subscription. SAN XOÁN DE RIO, Spain-The small building in a village near this town was once a school filled with children. Now it is a mortuary, a stark illustration of the demographic forces shaping Europe's future.

title: Novak Djokovic's Case for Entering Australia Was a Case of Covid-19 Last Month
summary: Documents filed to court that will rule on tennis star's deportation appeal show he tested positive on Dec. 16. SYDNEY-Novak Djokovic's application for a medical exemption from Australia's vaccination rules hinged on his infection with, and recovery from, Covid-19 in December.

title: Mystery Surrounds Absence of Kazakhstan's Longtime Leader
summary: Resume Subscription. For decades, Kazakh strongman Nursultan Nazarbayev forcefully put down challenges to his rule. When he stepped down as president in 2019, he chose a close ally as his successor and continued to wield power behind the scenes, diplomats say. The capital city was renamed after him.

title: Don't Work Out With Covid-19, at the Gym or Anywhere Else
summary: Asymptomatic carriers may be tempted to keep their fitness resolutions. Medical professionals say that's a bad idea.. Testing positive for Covid-19 means putting workouts on hold, even if you have zero or mild symptoms.

title: Restaurants Seek Aid as Omicron Threatens Another Hard Winter
summary: Small bars, eateries lobby Congress for additional funding as Covid-19 variant drives infections nationwide. Small restaurants are heading back to Congress for help, saying their challenges are worsening as the Omicron variant drives a surge in Covid-19 cases across the country.

title: Rocket Grew Into America's Biggest Mortgage Lender, but Now Comes the Hard Part
summary: Lender must convince investors that it can keep growing even if refinancings fall off. Rocket Cos. struck it big selling the American Dream. Now it has to convince investors it can keep growing even in a sleepy mortgage market.

title: Studies Help Show Why Omicron Is Mild, Spreads Fast
summary: Lab studies and clinical data support early reports about variant that is responsible for dramatic surge in Covid-19 cases. The threat posed by the Omicron variant has now come into sharper focus, with recent clinical data and laboratory studies lending support to early reports suggesting that it is milder but more transmissible than other variants of the new coronavirus.

title: U.S. to Spend $10 Billion to Boost Small Businesses
summary: Part of the Treasury Department funding will target disadvantaged communities, but some Republicans say spending overlaps with money available in existing programs. The U.S. is planning to hand out $10 billion to help upstart companies gain access to capital in a bid to rev up business in disadvantaged communities and spur a broader economic recovery from the pandemic.

title: Finding the Right Behavioral Links for Keeping Resolutions
summary: If you slip up on a New Year's commitment, the technique of 'chain analysis' can help identify what went wrong and how to fix it. A week into the new year, the resolutions that you made on Jan. 1 may be starting to slip away. Research has shown that most people struggle to persevere when they set goals. The good news is that if you're willing to think about setbacks productively rather than simply give up, you can use them to do better next time.

title: Why Apple's iMessage Is Winning: Teens Dread the Green Text Bubble

title: Want to Quarantine on a Beach? Go to Thailand
summary: Vacations in Thailand come with strings: obligatory R&R on the island of Phuket or other beach destinations. THAILAND, one of the few Asian countries currently open to American tourists, has an unusual entry protocol. The name itself conjures fun and sun: Phuket Sandbox.

title: The End of Car Keys, Passwords and Fumbling With Your Phone at Checkout
summary: The ultra-wideband, or UWB, technology that powers Apple's AirTags could reshape how we interact with devices-if companies can overcome privacy concerns and other hurdles. For all the attention on tech companies and location tracking in recent years, our gadgets are actually surprisingly bad at knowing precisely where they are at any given moment. That's about to change.

title: Meta Platforms' Head of Communications Leaves Company
summary: John Pinette ran the company's public relations teams since 2019. Meta Platforms Inc.'s head of communications said he is leaving the company in a Friday afternoon post to employees, creating a void at the top of the department managing the controversies surrounding the tech giant.

title: FAA Selects Airports for 5G Buffer Zones
summary: Zones aim to minimize flight disruptions by separating new wireless signals and aircraft. U.S. air-safety regulators have picked dozens of airports that would get buffer zones to help avoid expected flight disruptions once a new 5G wireless service goes live later this month.

title: Russia's Border Tensions Translate Into Market Pain
summary: Troops on Ukraine's border and unrest in neighboring Kazakhstan have unnerved investors, sending ruble to weakest level since April. Russian markets have come under unexpected pressure, with investors increasingly concerned about a possible invasion of Ukraine and the sudden unleashing of unrest in neighboring Kazakhstan.
